definition: to boil (of liquid)/boiling hot/Get out!/Go away!/fuck off (rude)
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The teapot should be warmed by pouring in a little boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 應倒進一點滾開的水把茶壺燙熱。

sentences.english: The glass will crack if you pour boiled water into it.
sentences.chinese: 一倒進去滾開水，這個玻璃杯就會破裂。

sentences.english: He kept on bothering me with silly questions that I told him to go fly a kite.
sentences.chinese: 他盡用些傻里傻氣的問題來煩我，故此我叫他滾開。

sentences.english: You can from my world scram Mody.
sentences.chinese: 你可以從我的世界麼滾開。

sentences.english: That's the biggest pile of bollocks I've ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 滾開，這是我聽過最荒謬的事。

sentences.english: The teapot shall be warmed by pouring in a little boiling water.
sentences.chinese: 應倒進一點滾開的水把茶壺燙熱。

sentences.english: I said you need to get out of here.
sentences.chinese: 我說了，你們兩個快給我滾開。

definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
